pr_title: Added mappings for Observation.interpretation and Observation.status for 2.1.0 and newer

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we actually need a custom version of the ObservationTranslator here, since the default version still calls the ObservationStatusTranslator. We just need to ensure that is properly overridden.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: hey Ian, this might work with status but what about translating the interpretations and it's not part of the origin implementation with platform 2.0.5
replies.author: jecihjoy

replies.bodyText: I think the solution there is to add an translator for interpretations similar to the dummy translator for observation status we have. That way, it's easy for implementors to support interpretations if they're currently capturing that information.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: That makes sense, I'll look into it
replies.author: jecihjoy

timeline.bodyText: I also don't think we need to implement this class for this change.
timeline.author: ibacher
ibacher

timeline.message: Added mappings for Observation.interpretation and Observation.status for 2.1.0 and newer
Added mappings for Observation.interpretation and Observation.status for 2.1.0 and newer
FM2-53 : Added mappings for Observation.interpretation and Observation.status for 2.1.0 and newer

timeline.bodyText:
So what we actually want to do here is to map not to text but to the coding using the code set defined here. So, for example, Obs.Interpretation.NORMAL should map to a structure that looks like this:
"interpretation": {
	"coding": [
		{
			"system": "http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-interpretation",
			"code": "N",
			"display": "Normal
		}
	],
	"text": "Normal"
}
Code-wise this looks something like (with the constants appropriately extracted out):
switch(obs.getInterpretation()) {
    case NORMAL:
		interpretation.addCoding().setSystem("http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-interpretation").setCode("N").setDisplay("Normal");
		interpretation.setText("Normal");
	...
}
The mappings should be something like:



OpenMRS Type
FHIR Interpretation




NORMAL
N


ABNORMAL
A


CRITICALLY_ABNORMAL
AA


CRITICALLY_HIGH
HH


CRITICALLY_LOW
LL


HIGH
H


LOW
L


OFF_SCALE_LOW
<


OFF_SCALE_HI
>


SIGNIFICANT_CHANGE_DOWN
D


SIGNIFICANT_CHANGE_UP
U


RESISTANT
R


SUSCEPTIBLE
S


INTERMEDIATE
I


POSITIVE
POS


NEGATIVE
NEG



The display values should be those in the valueset I linked above.
Some special handling is needed for the VERY_SUSCEPTIBLE interpretation, since this isn't supported by the valueset. For this case, it might make sense to add the coding for susceptible and then create an additional code with the system https://fhir.openmrs.org/ext/obs/interpretations, the code VS, and the display "Very Susceptible", which should also be the reported text.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: This is noted, working on it..
replies.author: jecihjoy

timeline.message: FM2-53 : Added mappings for Observation.interpretation and Observation.status for 2.1.0 and newer

timeline.bodyText: Use addCoding() instead of setCoding(). The former allows us to have multiple codings where it makes sense.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher  do we need to use addCoding() yet OpenMrs only supports a single interpretation to an Observation?
replies.author: jecihjoy
jecihjoy

replies.bodyText:
@ibacher do we need to use addCoding() yet OpenMrs only supports a single interpretation to an Observation?

So, addCoding() is basically a simpler way of achieving the same result without having to construct a list here.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText:
Also while doing the translations back to openmrs type, I suppose this would be the code
switch (interpretation.getCoding().get(0).getCode()){ case "N": openmrsObs.setInterpretation(Obs.Interpretation.NEGATIVE); break;
well it will not make sense to check the value at 0 if we're expecting more than one interpretation..

I'm not anticipating more than one interpretation here, so yes, just mapping from "N" to NEGATIVE is the right way to go.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: This actually needs to invert the toFhirResource() method. So here we expect a coding of, e.g., "NEG" and want to translate that into Obs.Interpretation.NEGATIVE
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: I think we should do the same thing here that we do to translate the interpretation into it's display value.
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: The FHIR observation status set is substantially larger than the OpenMRS observation status. What happens, for example, if we get an observation with the status "cancelled"? (I'd suggest writing a unit test that passes that status and try to fix the issue.
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Should be private (I'm bad about remembering this too)
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Can we construct this as we construct the other extension URLs? That way if we need to change something, we only have to change it in one place.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: OpenMrs only allows adding a single interpretation to an observation, addInterpretation() is not supported
replies.author: jecihjoy

replies.bodyText: So, I'm not suggesting we support multiple interpretations, just that obs.addInterpretation(interpretationTranslator.toFhirResource(observation)) does the same thing and is a bit shorter and clearer.
replies.author: ibacher
